main event: A military source observed a round object flying from southwest to southeast over Corong, New Mexico on 12 August 1951. The object appeared to change color from white to orange to green as it traveled at a speed of 700-1000 mph.
interesting points: The object's speed was estimated to be 700-1000 mph.
It changed color from white to orange to green as it moved.
The object's shape was described as round, with an approximate size of 6" diameter at arm's length.
The observation lasted for about 10 seconds, during which the object descended from 45 degrees above the horizon to just above the horizon.
The sighting was evaluated as a meteor, and there is no further case information in the file.
